text: All the nordstroms are awesome and this one was no different. I had great service and the food was excellent. When I used to live in California I used to get breakfast at the cafe in Brea every week. I decided I wanted to have their breakfast again so I went in and it was just as good as the last time I had it

Good food and friendly service! I eat here when I don't feel like eating "food court food" inside Fashion Show Mall. The prosciutto sandwich that comes with warm and crispy potato chips is delicious - you should try it and you won't be disappointed.
Great service and food . My husband and I walked up immediately sat us down , loved it .
Delicious food but very expensive .  It's a nice place to eat if you want to treat yourself to a upscale lunch while doing some shopping in fashion show mall.

All I have to say is I LOVE Nordstrom Cafe! I almost always order the Shrimp & Arugula Salad. It is soooo delicious! It comes with about 6 jumbo grilled shrimp and the polenta croutons are amazing! I have tried the recipe out of their cookbook for this, and even though the dressing tastes just like it, the croutons cannot be replicated. Also, i love the chimichurri sauce that comes with the steak, so i always order a side of it and eat it with the salad instead of the dressing. I have been taking my daughter there since before she was one and she loves their tomato soup and grilled cheese. Such a perfect little spot.

Wow, really love their tomato soup. If you love basil.. then add extra!! Always get this when I'm shopping and passing by. It's really hidden so as you walk in Nordstrom, ask someone for directions. I have tried a few sandwiches and they have Republic of Tea!! Yay. The only reason why I gave this place 4 stars is because of the price. Very pricey. But if you're passing by, its worth a try.

Awesome hide away!! Workers are very friendly and food is very nice. It's like a restaurant but price of cafe. Drink was 2.50 and pastries are very good from 2.25 to 5.50 ( cake, cookies, etc) very laid back and no tourists. Ahhhh :)
The food here is totally great! Santa Fe Chicken Sandwich is something out of this world!
I love love love Nordstroms Cafe!  If given the opportunity skip Starbucks and come here. Everything is always fresh and utterly delicious.
Found hair in my food. The manager blamed it on corn husk and offered free dessert. It clearly was human hair plus we had already bought dessert. Did not address the problem. VERY disappointed!

My coworkers and I come here all the time and the food is incredible!! I usually get the roasted salmon for only $12.50 and it comes with roasted zucchini, corn, carrots, potatoes, and peppers. DELICIOUS! And so filling! I would definitely recommend stopping by here the next time you are shopping around the mall. Its a shame I can't afford any of the clothes in Nordstrom but at least I get to enjoy the food! Ha ha take that!

Wow!  I am beyond impressed. For "quick" cafe food, Nordstroms knows how to deliver.  I am usually not a fan of salads, but their lime cilantro chicken salad was amazing!  And good value for vegas. 

Located hidden on the 3rd floor of Nordstrom's at the Fashion Show mall.  I totally recommend this place.  Service was unpretentious and friendly as well!
Salad Nicoise! Double chocolate chunk cookie. Then shop!

Awesome food.
Did not expect a store's restaurant to have such delicious options! Love that there are healthier options to choose from as well.
Great place to stop after shopping in the mall.
I had the Tomato Basil Soup, and the Santa Fe Panini, and it was delicious. Even better than the food was the awesome service.

I love this cafe. What I love about this place the most probably is the location. I love to eat here when I'm too lazy to walk all the way to the other side of the mall where the food court is located. This hidden eatery is located on the 3rd floor in between the home and junior sections of the department store.

They serve a variety of gourmet salads, sandwiches, pastas, pizzas and pastries. The prices are on the pricier side, but I feel the quality and taste of the food are worth it. I always end up with the chicken tomato alfredo with penne pasta. But my absolute favorite is the Roma tomato basil soup. I think I like it the best because it comes with this unbelievable parmesean crostini. *Ask for an extra and they are happy to oblige. 

If you end up liking the soup, you can always pick up a jar to take home. Too bad they don't sell those crostinis as well. (at least that I know of, I've never asked).

I always come here for a quick bite of the delicious tomato soup. I hadn't been here in a while, so when I visited today, I was surprised to find out that the food stayed consistently delicious!

I had a cup of the famous tomato basil soup with one croustini and a refreshing glass of ice water. The Nordstrom Marketplace Café never fails to impress me!

I also love how customers walk in, grab a tray, and are presented to a large array of the different options of food in the bakery displays. It's such a smart way to show off the café's uniqueness!

I would definitely reccomend this café to anyone who wants something casual and not too overpriced! I love it here.
Omgggggg. Best place ever I love their food!!! I always order their San a fe chicken sandwich  with lemonade nd it's to die for pretty clean nd really good customer service!!!!!!

I can't help it. I love this place. I've been here dozens of times over the years and my two aunts (shopaholics) make a point to come here everything they visit from LA. Not sure why, I'm pretty sure they have one there, but it's a requirement on all their visits. Maybe ours is just that much more awesome. I love the pastas, the paninis are pretty awesome, and their salmon ANYTHING is always fabulous. I love the pear/almond bars too. You can't shop on the third floor of Nordstrom and not be tempted by this amazing place. It's like a desert mirage in the middle of a department store.

WAY overpriced. Tasty sandwiches, but the chips are barely a step above Lays, and the drinks and desserts are priced outrageously. $33 for lunch is crazy, even for Vegas, at least for this basic level of cuisine.

The food was delicious and fresh. I had the Tuscan salmon with a ton of delicious grilled veggies on the side. Since there were so many things I wanted to try, I also got a 1/2 order, which they allow with no problem, of wild mushroom ravioli.This was to die for, and I will definitely get a full order next time. For dessert, I ordered the strawberry and creme cake, which looked delicious. However, it was dry and only had tiny specks of strawberries throughout the layers. I was expecting big juicy strawberries, so I won't be ordering this next time. One confusing thing was tipping the servers. Since it was a cafeteria and I carried my own tray, I didn't think there would be servers. I felt obligated to tip because they did refill my drink and checked on me. However, I had no cash on me. When I ordered a dessert from the server, the receipt had no area to leave a tip. So I had to embarrassingly ask if I could leave him a tip with my credit card. It was no problem and he brought me back cash, which was a bit awkward because he had to ask me how much I wanted. Despite these minor things, I loved the food and will be going back.

I ordered the Wild Salmon with Roasted Vegetables & Farro entree here.  The vegetables were fresh and the farro, a type of grain, was flavorful and it went well with this meal.  My only criticism is that the salmon was slightly dry.  I would definitely order this dish again, but I would request that the salmon be a little less cooked.
Wow great place to get a good meal and a good price within all the craziness of Las Vegas.

I went here for the first time, and it was definitely not what I expected. 

I loved the casual atmosphere with the wall of windows. It's definitely a bit of a hidden gem within the gargantuan complex of Fashion Show. 

The food was decent. I ordered a sandwich, and each sandwich comes with a great number of toppings. I would eat here again, and it would be a good place for a business lunch, but I do not crave the food. I have heard the tomato soup is some of the best in town.

we tried the cilantro and Chinese salads and the veggie spicy soup and it was delicious... 
it was an order to go and the girl who gave me the food didnt close the lid for one of the soups and it made a mess! but still was delicious...

Love Nordstrom's Cafe! It's my favorite spot to grab food whenever I'm at the Fashion Show mall. I usually end up eating a salad - they have a variety to choose from. My favorite is the shrimp and arugula and the Chinese chicken. I also can't dine there without picking up a cup of their tomato soup. It's so delicious, especially when dipped with the bread/crouton it comes with. 

The only thing that bothers me is the calorie intake on a lot of the food items. Yes, you're eating a salad, but it's also 900+ calories. (Eye roll) 
Anyways, I think the best thing here are the desserts. The brownie is probably the best I've ever had. Skip the cookies, they're always pretty hard and stale.
It is very casual. Friendly staff. Food was pretty good as well. It is pretty hidden though.

I came to Vegas and chose this restaurant out of all of them on the strip.  Surprisingly awesome for being a cafe in a department store.  Great value.  Had the salmon and veggies.  Everything was cooked perfectly.

I AM OBSESSED WITH NORDSTROM CAFE!  I think Nordstrom Cafess are pretty consistent across the board, so if you've been to one, you've been to them all.

Every time I go to a Nordstrom Cafe, I completely forget how it works and end up babbling like a neanderthal.  So, there's a paper version of the menu at the beginning of the counter (it's kind of hidden), but most people that eat here are loyal Nordstrom Cafe frequenters, so they already know they're going to get the Tomato Basil Soup (which is rumored to have crack in it).  You place your order, receive a glass for your beverage, and are provided with a sign with a number on it.  You pay at the cashier, then sit down at any table and place the sign on your table.  A friendly server will provide you with silverware and eventually bring your food over.

The service here is surprisingly impeccable considering its fast-casual concept.  After realizing I didn't have silverware, I felt like an idiot who missed something, but my server arrived immediately to provide me with some and said, "I read your mind" with a smile. The servers are very attentive and check on you frequently.

I am addicted to the California Grill sandwich.  It features roast turkey, tomato, bacon, swiss cheese, avocado, and garlic aioli all between two pieces of grilled sourdough bread.  It's an amazing combination of flavors and textures!  Of course, the Tomato Basil Soup with the crostini is perfect on a cold day, or any day for that matter.

Quick, attentive service and delicious food - how can you complain?  It's a little pricy, but definitely worth it.
Had the spicy shrimp with angel hair pasta and it was delicious... But very very spicy.  Also, tomato soup was great as well as the garlic bread.  Coffee was fresh and the coconut cake was fantastic
Nordstrom Cafe offers a decent selection of food and drink items - I call it 3.5 which is great for a quick eatery in a fashion retailer.

"Grilled Shrimp Sweet Corn and Arugula Salad"

Tried it. Bought it. Loved it. Bought it again. Resisted licking the plate.

Best salad I have ever had in my life!! Seriously, who needs a boyfriend when you can have this salad?!!! The croutons give your taste buds a warm welcome. They are fresh, warm, and delicately seasoned. The spinach is lightly drizzled in dressing (which I think they should rename Heaven). The grilled sweet corn and cherry tomatoes give the salad a little euphoric touch putting all the other salads to shame. Finally, the star of the show: the Succulent, juicy, seasoned to perfection grilled shrimp...Oh.My.Gosh. Have you ever been in love? This salad will make you reconsider.

Seldomly eat sandwich as me, I liked their California sandwich so much. The bread was itself very crispy and the avocado and bacon was such a good match. Also liked their creme brulee, caramel was about the right level of sweetness. However one thing a bit disappointed me was that they forgot our order of creme brulee until we went to the counter and asked...

Mmmmmmm! Tomato basil soup, shrimp and polenta salad, berry salad, salmon salad, angel hair with shrimp, mushroom ravioli, I could go on and on. I've never had a bad meal here. The food is fresh and delicious and reasonably priced. They also do a great job with to go food for small catered business luncheons.

Now I like this place.  I can get a cup of soup and half a sandwich.  Perfect!  The selection is  nice and although a bit dark the atmosphere is nice.  The fact that you can seat yourself is great.  If there's a booth available the staff don't look at you funny if you're with only one other person and you take a booth.  
The service is a bit hit and miss.  Sometimes, things come out from the kitchen quickly and other times you could die waiting.  No explanation for this as there's really no rhyme or reason to it.
Today we went upstairs to have lunch there and the line was ridiculous.  The only explanation I can come up with is that there are times when they hold back the line as there are no tables.  So, natch, we didn't eat there today.

I think it's time they replace Gale the server. I try to avoid her section of at all possible.

She's the slowest waitress they have, and rarely comes back to refill drinks

I had a lunch date here with one of my good friends. We decided to go here because we heard the food is healthier and mucho delicioso. Ordering was really easy, because there is a display of all the food you could possibly get - this made it easier to choose. The hard part was choosing WHAT to get, because everything looked so good. I only ordered a sandwich and it took maybe 30 minutes to get. My friend had gotten a salad and was almost done with it, and I hadn't even got my sandwich yet. There were multiple times where I tried to flag down the waitresses, but oh man, is it difficult to get their attention. All in all, the food is good but the service was blah

Absolutely LOVE THIS PLACE I tried almost everything and my absolute favorite it will be the Tuscan roasted chicken love that stuff the potatoes are cooked to perfection the dessert is also my favorite part I love the blueberry tart, everything in the menu is so delicious.

So good! I come here just for lunch sometimes without even shopping, its that good.  Im not sure I've ever eaten "department store food" but it doesn't sound appealing to me.  Nordstroms cafe is great, tons of healthy fare like salads and soup (umm tomato basil, hello my fave!) but great sandwiches, pasta and pastries.  and i love that they have every meal on display for you to see. (nothing like something coming out that you envisioned totally wrong) And the prices are very good in my opinion, usually 10-14 a plate, especially considering you're eating on the strip.  
PS theres beer and wine too!

Consistently great food and service.

When you're tired of mall food courts and pricey Strip restaurants, Marketplace Cafe on the 3rd floor of Nordstrom is the perfect place to go.

Upon entering the cafe, you see the sample dishes in the refrigerator case and out on the counter. The visuals provided by these sample dishes are incredibly helpful when you're hangry or indecisive. I usually go for one of their sandwiches as they are always consistent with portion and taste.The chicken club with maple glazed bacon is my go to sandwich because of the thicker cut bacon and peppercorn aïoli. All sandwiches include chips..which for $11.50 in Las Vegas, is not a bad deal.

During my last visit I tried the coffee cake: a generous portion with just the right amount of sweet and crumbly to complement a piping hot cup of coffee.

I had lunch here  for the very first time and I will be back.  I got the Chicken and Pesto Panini and the Tomato Basil Soup.  After just a cup of the soup, I longed for more, it was so creamy and flavorful - have them add some fresh basil to the top - this is by far the best tomato basil soup I've ever had.  

The panini was very good, with the perfect combination of flavors.  The cheese was at a perfect melting point and the pesto was dead on.  The only downside was the significant lack of chicken on the panini.  I'm sure at least half of my bites had no chicken in them, but the flavor mix of the other ingredients made it a great cheese sandwich!  

I thought it was reasonable priced for Nordstrom - just over $40 for 2 cups of soup, one pasta, two paninis and two drinks.

I will recommend and will be back.

Shhh...don't tell anyone this place is great...hidden in plain sight. 

The food and the prices are the same as every other Nordstrom Cafe around the country.

You can't go wrong with the Grilled cheese and tomato soup plate. Salads are tasty and pizzas are good too. I always forget about this place when I'm at the mall  and whenever I go I'm always pleased! The service is prompt and fresh... for a walk up and order type place that's always pleasing. Ohh and do yourself a favor and have a Choco chip cookie warmed up, you won't be sorry!

I normally love eating at this place, but today was a totally different experience. I ordered a bowl of soup and nothing else. The soup tasted delicious as always, but as soon as I sat down I got absolutely NO SERVICE!!! Nobody took the time to say hi to me or even give me silverware. I had to take it upon myself and get napkins because NOBODY would make eye contact with me so I can get their attention!!! Where is the great service that I normally get from this place?! Absolutely horrible!!! I won't be coming back to this place anytime soon.

Excellent lunch spot with relaxed atmosphere in the hectic Strip!

Nordstroms, love you!

I really like this place. Easy to order. It's cafeteria style tho. The servers do make sure you get your order and anything else you would like. 

Frank is always my favorite. The asst manager, Ryan, is so pleasant. There's other servers here and the support staff they have are so accommodating. 

The shrimp salad with arugula is a must. The sandwiches are good especially the turkey cranberry.
The best service thank you. Great people  Angelica needs 5 star by her self. THANK YOU NORDSTROM

Great club sandwich and berry salad. Nice dining area. Friendly service. Their order intake system is a bit weird but they show you where to go. Salads are ordered in one place, hot food is ordered somewhere else, desserts are ordered at another counter, etc.  It all in all, good food. Overpriced though.

Do not even think about eating at the food court...come here instead! The cafe is on the 3rd floor of Nordstrom at FSM. A little out of the way, but totally worth it.

You are presented with sample dishes in a classic refrigerator case. Orders are placed with the staff behind the counter and they give you any pre-prepared items (like soup, or dessert) for you to carry to your table. A server brings your meal and drinks when ready.

Because of previous reviews I got the tomato soup. There's a reason they sell it in to-go bottles people...its creamy and smooth and well seasoned. In short, deelish.

I also ordered a beef dip sandwich. All the things that can go wrong with that sandwich went really really right! Bread was crunchy without being hard to bite into, dipping au jus in a proper bowl (I hate when the bowl is too small to dip). Kettle chips on the side. 

Couldn't pass up the brownie for dessert. Huge square of chewy chocolatey goodness.

Way to go Nordstrom. I'll be back for all my shopping fuel needs.

One of my all time favorite spots in town, the tomato soup is always delicious, all of the salads are large and filling (my favorite is the Chinese chicken salad), service is great and their main dishes rival many restaurants to be honest. Also very peaceful place to dine as well. Highly recommend.

Oh.My.Goodness.  This place is awesome times infinity.  I decided to try the Nordstrom Cafe at the suggestion of my co-workers and was excited to have a Sunday morning brunch there with my fiance.  I should have read the other reviews a bit more closely because when we arrived, we were surprised to find that the cafe is cafeteria style.  We were frantically panning the items behind the glass and spotted a menu at the last minute when we got to the counter.  Since there was a long line behind us, my FI decided on the pesto panini and cup of tomato soup and I ordered what my co-workers suggested- a bowl of tomato soup and the mixed berry chicken salad, with a fresh squeezed lemonade.  For dessert we got a chocolate chip, macadamia cookie.

Wandering into the busy dining room with our trays we found a little booth and were pleasantly surprised when a server arrived with silverware and to take our trays away.  The food was delicious!  The salad could not have been better and the soup... oh the soup.  I showed some self control and saved the cookie for later and even my FI enjoyed splitting that, and he does not really like sweets (crazy, I know).  

Now I am worried that every time I go back to the Nordrstrom Cafe, I will continue to order the same thing because I loved it so much!

Enjoyed another great meal this past weekend. I realized this place has a great view of the strips most iconic hotels, the Wynn and Palazzo. 

The food and service were excellent! 

The AC was on full blast... Can't wait to come back!

We had lunch here on an early Sunday afternoon. The decor is upscale comfortable and the service is very friendly.

The food selection is not huge, but there is probably enough to suit most tastes. It feels slightly above average in price, but the quality is definitely there.

We had some coffee, an Italian Egg Drop soup, a Penne Bolognese, a Chinese Chicken Salad and a Magic Bar. All of the food was very high quality and tasted delicious. I particularly enjoyed the Penne Bolognese. It just tasted really right and was extremely satisfying.

Overall a slightly pricey, but very satisfying and comfortable place to have a bite to eat.

It was nice!

They have an unusual blend of service and self-service. We ordered and paid at the front, cafeteria style, and sat ourselves at a table. Then someone introduced themself as our server. We did everything on our own up to that point, so it was kind of late to introduce the concept of a server. We would have happily gone the full mile and brought our food to our table ourselves. In any case, they brought our food to our table, but the other 3 aspects of service -- ordering, seating, and paying -- we did ourselves, so we only tipped 1/4 of the amount we would have tipped for full service.

If for some reason you want to avoid the massive brunch buffets in Vegas, the Nordstrom Cafe is a pleasantly relaxing option for breakfast. Yeah, it's in the mall at a department store, but the food is quite good.  I had the manageably sized mushroom, spinach & cheese omelet, with toast, a bit of potatoes, and a cup of fruit.  All pleasingly presented and satisfying to the palate -- especially the fluffy eggs. We had great service and the food came quick.

A great little place for a great meal hidden away in Nordstrom. 

Casino food seems to be at a premium, so getting fresh and quality food for a great price makes everything better.
The wine list, although abbreviated, was high quality. The biggest downside of the meal is that you order cafeteria style. Service was quick and polite.
I had the Spicy Wild Shrimp, and my spouse had a chicken and tortellini dish. She and I tasted back and forth, and it was a toss up for winner.

I've been here a few times for lunch.  The service has not been impeccable when I've been here.  In fact, it has been downright slow.  Most of their bottled drinks require a bottle opener.  I usually end up using my car keys because they take so frickin long to come over and open it.  Very classy.

Lunch here has always taken a surprisingly long time given that it is cafeteria style.  Actually the whole cafeteria style design is kind of stupid because the only thing you can really get right away is the soup.  Everything, salads included, gets made back in the kitchen and the food takes about 10-15 minutes in my experience.

The tomato basil soup was really good when I had it.  I realized recently that they always have it, even if it isn't posted on the soup of the day board.  So get it.  The cajun salmon Caesar salad was also pretty good.

Not a good place for a fast lunch but if you have time to just chill, check it out.

A Nordstrom Cafe in different name. Not Nordstrom Bistro.
I am very comfortable in any Nordstrom Cafe or Bistro.
Had arugula & prosciutto pizza and clam chowder.
Good as any other Nordstrom cafe in the US.
Service was friendly as usual.
Good place sit comfi away from casinos.

I love the tomato soup and the berry salad. I get extra croutons for the soup because it's the best to dip with. The berry salad is filled with blue cheese, berries, and delicious candy walnuts. Plus, the salad dressing is made with real berries. 

The wait can be long, but it's always worth it. I consider this to be one of my favorite lunch spots in Las Vegas.

I want to send a extra thank you to Angelica who assisted my family. Her service was 5 star!

I don't know why I was so reluctant to dine at the Nordstrom Cafe at first; time after time, the quality of the food proves to be superior to other local offerings, regardless of the particular Nordstrom location. In this case, we were at the Fashion Show Mall, and I opted for the cranberry sandwich on the advice of the server. My wife got the blackened salmon on a Caesar salad. Both were excellent, and the service as always was friendly and attentive.

The only thing I would point out is that the room temperature always seems to lean a bit towards the polar ice caps side of the thermometer. For me, this is a plus, but be warned if you are one of those people who likes a warm room.

Looking for a low maintenance lunch? This is definitely worth checking out then. They offer a nice variety of sandwiches, soups, pastas, salads, etc with good portions and fair prices. I shared a panini with my boyfriend without additonal charges for the split. My personal favorite was the tomato basil soup. I'm not sure if it was due to the rainy weather but it was very comforting and hit the spot with its great texture and flavor. Even though it was a spontaneous lunch stop, I'll definitely be back if in the area!

A nice alternative for brunch!

If you're looking for a quality but affordable spot in the day cause you're saving your money for bacchanal, try this place. 

The food was delicious reasonably priced,at least for vegas standards.   My guys enjoyed their meals.  I recommend the sante fe chicken sandwich.

The best stuff and the service very good atmosphere v good five star if you're one of the best food in the Mall about price
Very reasonable

I love this cafe! I live in Vegas and go to the Fashion show mall often and eat here almost every time I really love the employees. Good food and I really love the way this café is set up. I've tried almost everything here and I have to say their tomato basil soup is my absolute favorite and comes with a side of garlic bread for an awesome price. Also has a great view of the strip if you get a booth by the window. 
I also love that they have all of their foods sampled on a display. Whether it's summer or winter I can always count on this café to have quick great food while I'm shopping and I love the little chocolates they give you with your bill.
What a great place to have lunch and a glass of wine while shopping for fabulous Nordstroms attire

This is where you'll find me and my coworkers (that have turned me into a fan!)  Great food, great staff, and awesome service.  It doesn't take long to get your food.  Salads, soups, entrees, sandwiches, desserts....  All that have been good.  

My favorite:  Chicken Parmesan Salad (roasted corn inside...yum), & Chicken Cesar Salad .

If I could eat here almost everyday I would!  The staff make lunch so comfortable there.

Good very yummy!!! Bread on my panini a tad to hard but sandwhichs are juicy full of flavor!!$ never dry making U need to wash it down!!!! The workers always look a little lost lol but very yummy!!!! I come here often
1st time coming to check out this place. SUPER GOOD! Food is fresh and fast. Pricing isn't bad for the location and food is delicious. Must try if wanting something fresh at a mall.

I came here with my family on the day after Christmas. BIG mistake.  Super long wait to even place our order, despite that there were only 2 groups ahead if us in line. We also made the mistake of putting the tip on the bill when we placed our order.  We took our seats and wound up getting our own drinks and coffee because the Hispanic female server couldn't be bothered. When she finally came to our table we told her that we already got our own drinks even though we had already left a tip on the bill.  She said, "oh...ok...good". For whatever reason, a male server took over our table.  He was more attentive with drink refills but when the food came out, another disappointment.  The 2 salads that we ordered looked like they scraped the bottom of the barrel to gather the ingredients.  The Chinese chicken salad had only 2 tiny orange wedges and they were mashed flat.  My wife's shrimp arugula salad had a few corn kernels like they fell in by accident and weren't an ingredient. My daughters pasta dish lacked any flavor, bland mushy noodles.  My wife and daughter always raved about this place. They said it's not usually like this. Needless to say I was not impressed. I will not be rushing back there.

It is pricey, but we love the cafe. The tomato soup is amazing, the desserts are very good and they have great kids choices. It can be hard to find a table if you come during the lunch rush, but early (before like 1130am) or late (after 130ish) and you're probably ok.

Good food but the set up is a little weird. It looks like a buffet/cafeteria but you really just look at all the food demos and then just order and they bring it to your table. 
I had the Parmesan crusted chicken salad and it was sooo good although a little small for almost $12 and just a TAD heavy on the dressing. Overall good and unique options for inside a department store.

Somewhat like Panera, but so so much better.

My chicken pesto panini was great, though I wish they had honored my request to leave out the tomatoes.  Chocolate chunk cookie was delicious & just what I was craving.

The service is what makes it though.  Seriously, I can't remember how many times our server filled our water glasses.  Much better than what I was expecting.

The cafe at Nordstrom's offers good food with a luxurious ambiance that you come to expect at Nordstrom.  The food is reasonably priced and the service is also good.  Definitely, a go to spot in the fashion show mall.

Called ahead and was told they close at 8 PM. Drove all the way from the south valley, about 25 minutes to arrive and find them closing. When I spoke to the manager and said I told him I called and they to I was told they close at 8 o'clock she said sorry we decided to close at seven.

One of the best mid-priced cafes in Las Vegas.  There seriously isn't a bad item on the menu!  Service is always great.  Their tomato soup and nordy cookies are awesome.  I'd swing by here just to grab a cookie if I'm in the area.  Some of my favs are their pizzas, the cranberry turkey sandwich, the chicken and artichoke pasta, and did I mention the nordy cookie?

Nordstrom Cafe is located on the third floor of Nordstroms (obviously) and once you walk in, there are staffs who take your order whenever you're ready. They have displays out showing what the food will look like. It is more of like a fancier version of Panera Bread. Once you are ready to order, they give you a number, and can be seated pretty much anywhere and the server will come out with your food once it is ready. There portions of the food is quite large, and if you do decide to give this place a try, you must try the tomato soup. They have the best tomato soups I have ever tasted!!

Always love coming here whenever I'm in the mall/Nordstrom. It's an order first, then find a seat type of restaurant. The sitting capacity is pretty big so even if you go during peak hours, you'll still find a seat. We're always greeted with friendly staff. Their tomato basil soup and the spicy shrimp angel hair pasta is always a must for me! Best part about it is you can ask for half portions whenever you're not too hungry to eat a full meal but still want to satisfy your cravings. My husband always order something different on every visit so I get to taste other foods on their menu. Their salads and pizzas are great too! Definitely on the top of my fave places to eat on the strip.

Located on the third floor inside the Nordstrom at the Fashion Show Mall, this cafe is a hidden gem on the strip. Hands down one of the best cafes in the city. They are on point and always deliver a fresh, tasty and memorable meal. Servers are polite and attentive. Gale in the dining room is a pleasant lady with a smile always on her face. 

As previously mentioned, the tomato bisque is heavenly and a must try. It's become their signature staple side item and just about everyone gets it who comes here. I just had the mozzarella prosciutto ciabatta sandwich and it was fantastic. The cafe was busy for a 3pm on a Sunday. Side note: they have decent Wi-Fi, so you can bring your laptop and get some work done (or surf the web). 

I am a big fan of the Nordstrom Marketplace Cafe at Fashion Show Mall. I have been a repeat customer for years. I try to come every time I am at the mall or close by. It's that good. You will love it too. 

Keep up the good work Marketplace Cafe!!

This is my second time eating here and it's as good as I remember it. I ordered the Spicy Shrimp Angel Hair pasta and it exceeded my expectations, partly because I'm not a huge shrimp fan. The spice was just enough to keep the meal enjoyable and true to its name. The staff was friendly and helpful. Gale made sure that I was taken care of during my visit. I'm happy I chose this place for an early lunch. Great little gem of the Vegas Valley.

The food here is worth the trek to the 3rd floor of Nordstrom's. Order, pay, find a seat, and wait for your order to be brought to the table. Prices on some dishes seemed a bit high, but the serving sizes and quality of the food made up for the high prices. Minimal interaction with staff which is fine by me. Helps keep my meal and conversations uninterrupted.

The only this I order regularly here is the Tomato Basil Soup and my son always orders the Kids Grilled Cheese w/ tomato soup. The items are absolutely delicious and compare all the other tomato soups I try to Nordstoms soup.

I love to shop and what better place to shop than the fashion show mall? So while wearing myself out shopping till i drop I always do a pit stop here at nordstroms and today was nothing different. 
One of my favorite things here is their soup. Tomato basil is always there while everyday they change the other option to a "soup of the day." Between the pumpkin soup and the spicy asian veggie I don't know which one could be my favorite. Lucky for me everytime I happen to drop on in he spicy asian veggie is on tab. (woohoo for my taste buds.) It happened to be the lucky one today so I was a happy lady. I ordered a small cup to get me by while sharing a nordie cookie with my mom. (think a giant fluffy cookie all with chocolate chunks, coconut, and macadamia nuts. all for $1.95!) The cup of soup goes for $3.50 while a bowl goes for $4.50. Talk a bout a cheap lunch and something a little better than the food court. If soup isn't your fancy than I would recommended anyone of the pizza's or panini sandwiches.
The service here is always lovely. They are always smiling. (or maybe my excited smile for my soup just catches on!) They are always willing to help and fill your drinks for you. Also the little dessert chocolate mints they give you at the end are pretty awesome. I'm a fan of them.

good food, reasonable price, nice decor.  i had the salmon with grilled veggies and everything tastes good.

i would have given five stars, but this is a cafe rather than a restaurant.  u carry a tray and stand in line to order your food.  also it was a long walk from the entrance to the farthest corner of the Fashion Show Mall to get here.
We love coming here. The service is always great along with a pleasant atmosphere. Oh, and Amazing food..... and the desserts... you have to try it.

This place is an absolute hidden gem! Everything is mostly between $10-15, and is incredibly fresh and high quality. With all the outrageously-priced, low quality options available on the strip, this was a refreshing discovery. 

I had the pear and blue cheese salad and it was delicious! Altogether I spent $15 on the salad, a bottle of water, and a chocolate cupcake (also amazing). 

Vegetarians/vegans: beware of the raved about tomato soup - they use chicken stock as the base :(

Overall, I highly recommend!

This nordstrom cafe is very different from the ones on the east coast that I'm used to! You order at the counter and seat yourself but the food is fantastic! I love their salads. Plus the 7-layer magic bar is AMAZING! The service is good and the store is clean.

Ok so every so often i like to feel...fancy.  Now mind you, you carry a tray (who cares) but the selection of food here is so good!!  I got the shrimp and arugula salad.  So yummy!!!!  The ambiance is quiet and pleasing to the eye too.  My friend's steak was so good.  And for dessert we got creme brulee.  Reminds me of my french friend's creme brulee!!  (Don't tell her i said that) I'm trying not to come back everyday lol

This review is for 3.5 stars.

The Cafe is located on the third floor of Nordstrom's.  It definitely has a taste of a higher scale cafe (and the price), but has the feeling of a more quality Panera.  To begin, the tomato soup was exceptional.  The shrimp and aragula salad was fine but for about $12, I was expecting a better presented concoction and a more thought out meal instead of just throwing corn, arugula, and shrimp into a bowl for service. Still tasty but not quite top chef. I will be back again because it is very convenient to my work.  Do not expect a strip restaurant.  Imagine a low scale Paris street restaurant where you caan get a nice lunch in your local mall for around $15.

As good as all the reviews have said. Stayed in hotel across the street and enjoyed these fresh healthy meals for lunch.
Much better than hotel food.

First off not all Nordstroms Cafe are created equal. They all have different menus depending on their region. The Las Vegas menu doesn't change much, but they will offer a "special" on occasion. We like their menu, it's simple & consistent. The runners are attentive & very helpful...especially with our children. I can honestly say we haven't had a bad experience...yet. (knock on wood) The roasted chicken with roasted vegetables,, caesar salad with parmesan chicken, tomato basil soup...are all good.  And I never had a crappy bowl of Mixed Berries...they sell out fast. The kids cheese pizza is always good...says the kids. Go give it a try...good service & great menu. If you don't try it...thats fine with us, We don't want it too crowded.

I have to talk myself out of coming here everyday! My favorite is the Nicoise Salad with salmon. 
I also love the Grilled Shrimp Sweet Corn and Arugula Salad and the Tuscan Roasted Chicken with veggies. Oh and the Mushroom Ravioli, the grilled cheese and tomato soup.... Just about everything that is served here is so delish! 

Go try it for yourself:)

Marketplace Cafe can be a hidden gem for locals if the planets properly align. It's located on the 3rd floor of the Fashion Show Mall, which means depending on the time of year, it can be overrun with tourists. But if you go during the week and avoid peak lunch time, you're in for a treat! 

I've never been disappointed with the food at Marketplace Cafe! My favorite dish is the Classic French Dip. I'm not exaggerating when I say that THIS IS THE BEST FRENCH DIP YOU'LL EVER HAVE IN YOUR LIFE! The warm roast beef paired with the sharp white cheddar on a Parmesan baguette is my idea of heaven. I could eat this sandwich every day of the week. 

The service can be inconsistent every once in a while; it really just depends on the time of year and how busy they are. If you have the place to yourself, you shouldn't have any problems--and this is usually the case. But if they are busy, be prepared to wait a little longer than you might expect for your food, and the servers to take awhile to check on you. 

Overall, if you want to experience the BEST French Dip in Las Vegas, or any other assortment of really hearty, wholesome dishes, Marketplace Cafe is a hidden gem that's definitely worth the effort of making your way through Fashion Show Mall!

I have gone here so many times and have been waiting to write a review.  Tonight, a friday night in which I have the cough and have nothing else better to do, is the night when I want to share with other yelpers the awesome-ness of this cafe.

I never really liked salad.  To me, it's too boring.  Boy was I wrong when I gobbled down the Mixed Berry Salad with chicken.  Now I have the love for this salad.  The combination of the different berries (strawberries, blackberries and raspberries), candied walnuts, crumbled blue cheese, mixed with lovely fresh greens and blackberry champagne vinaigrette over it is amazingly refreshing.  People who loves berries must try this.  oh so GOOD.

I've tried the tuscan chicken entree and the chicken I had was juicy and nice.  It comes with grilled veggies (potatoes, carrots, zucchinis and red bell pepper).  My bf ordered another time, and he said his chicken was dry though.  That sucks for him, but I enjoyed my food, please see below.

I had the.....drum roll please...GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICH w/TOMATO BASIL SOUP!!!!!
yep yep, from the kid's menu, but i don't care.  It's super yummy to me.  I had the sourdough bread, in which you have the option of them making it using wheat bread.  The kid's meal comes with a drink (i chose oj) and a bowl of fresh fruit.  Guess how much does my favorite meal cost at this awesome cafe?  under $5 bucks!  

Their cookies are very big and good as well.  They are soft and chewy.  I had their triple chocolate brownie, it was decent, not something that i would order again though.  I have also tried their lemon bar.  It was refreshing.  My bf ate it and said it taste like a soap bar, but again, lemon isn't his flavor, why did I even bother to shove a piece down his throat...BECAUSE i want him to taste the yummy stuff that I taste.  O well, i will not waste anymore yummy stuff on someone who doesn't know how to savor lemony stuff.  Which means...MORE FOR ME!!!

The end of the meal, they give you chocolate mint sticks, which are fabulous, icing on the cake for me.  

Yum Yum Yum...

I have two staples here that keep me coming back:

1. The Tomato Basil Soup, otherwise known as Crack Soup. Just scroll through all of the reviews if you don't want to take my word for it and see how many other Yelpers will rave on and on and about this stuff. The hype is real!

2. The Pesto Chicken Panini. Ahhhh, even typing it makes me happy and kind of hungry. This panini is perfection to me.

The Nordstrom Cafe is located at the Fashion Show Mall inside of Nordstrom on the third floor. Walking in, just head to the right and grab a tray for yourself and a refreshment on your way to the line. Tell the nice ladies what you would like to order and then proceed to the cash register. Nordstrom Cafe believes in physical menus and everything look amazing. If you think it looks good, just order it.

After you pay, go to an open table and your server will remove the tray and bring out your food order. You get fun, little chocolate mint sticks at the end of your meal.

If I am not eating my Pesto Chicken Panini then I am getting the Peppered Steak on Sourdough, panini-style.
Another amazing Nicoise Salad :) with a huge bowl of the most amazing berries I have ever eaten!!

I've been here off and on over the past few years and didn't make a visit this year until today! I enjoyed eating here when I used to work at the mall as an alternative to the tedious food court choices. 

I usually order the pepperoni and mushroom pizza (think I might have ordered the Chinese chicken salad before, not sure) but this time I decided to step outside of my comfort zone and order a panini for the first time. Got the pesto chicken since I love pesto and I definitely enjoyed it! I was skeptical of the cheese included...but all the ingredients work out for the best and compliment each other. My only criticism is that the pesto could have been richer in taste, but then again I doubt its made in house otherwise it would take longer for the panini to come out.

The shades happened to be down when I stopped by, but when its up you get a great view of the Wynn from across the street!

Had the berry nut salad, and it was awesome. Great way to start the evening before seeing the show. Ashley was great and even gave us our ice teas to go. Not too pricey and not cheap, but worth every penny!! I recommend this restaurant highly!
can never beat a Nordstrom café - been to them in Las Vegas  Tysons Corner  Seattle  Tacoma   Boulder  Atlanta - all great
The best salmon salad I ever had. A surprising, delicious lunch option at this end of the mall. The most delicious food for an impatient, hungry shopper. So happy Lisa L and I gave it a try.

Everything here is great I've been coming here for about 10 years and I'm never disappointed. The service is usually great. The prices are reasonable and the tomato soup is delicious! California sandwich is very popular as well. All desserts are enjoyable!

My boyfriend brought me there to try something new while we were shopping. Cute quant place tucked in the back. We ordered the Creme Brulee. OMG nom nom nom. It was so good! $5 and it was more than enough for us to share. 

I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 because of the service. Confusing much? 
So we ordered and grabbed our food and sat down. as we sat down a server came by and asked us if we wanted anything to drink...Wtf? We had that option when we ordered our food. We politely said no, and he looked rather annoyed. Are we supposed to tip this guy? As we were leaving he left a thank you card with some mints. Again are we supposed to tip this guy? Im all for tipping when it is deserved but come on I don't give away money for nothing.  

Maybe Im the only one for the confusion. But anyway like I said the Creme Brulee is definitely worth stopping by!
This place makes me feel at home. Grew up in a restaurant just like this place, but bigger. I love you Nordstrom cafe.

Great food, great atmosphere, great service. Husband and I started with the clam chowder which was the best we both ever had - it actually had whole baby clams in it. WIN! 

Now to the entrees and then the dessert: I got the Parmesan crusted chicken salad and husband got the salmon dish with roasted baby potatoes. SO GOOD! My salad had very interesting but delicious flavors and husbands dish was cooked perfectly. Potatoes were delicious and the salmon was very moist but flakey too. 

For dessert, we got the blueberry tarte and tge raspberry and almond tarte. These were just ok. 

Overall, wonderful experience

Love love love this place! You always know what to expect... Most places show you a photo or a food display and when you receive it, it has no resemblance to what you are served... This place has good prices, portions, and good food. Tomato soup rocks, salads are very tasty and fresh, pastas, sandwiches, hot dishes, tried almost all and have yet to find something I dislike. It's also very casual as it's a cafe... So it's perfect to take my son to.

This is a great place to have lunch.  When I lived in Vegas, we'd come here once or twice a week.  However, now that I live in AZ, I only come here to meet up with old friends.  That was the occasion on my most recent visit.

I had the Turkey, Bacon, Avocado, Lettuce, Tomato Sandwich on Foccacia Bread....yum!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/nordstrom-cafe-las-vegas?select=dhC_-JZUyJuIL6AacdiYHg#dhC_-JZUyJuIL6AacdiYHg

You order it cafeteria style, forming a line and grabbing your drinks and Chips along the way.  You then pay for your food and they'll either call your number or find you at your table.

The place will get packed around lunchtime, so it's best if you divide and conquer.  Have a couple of friends find an open table and snag it while you order and pay for the food.  That's the most efficient way to dine here.

Return Factor - 80%

This is my favorite Nordstrom cafe location by far. Beats all the ones in Los Angeles mainly because its in the heart of Las Vegas and Iove how a sample of the food is placed on a counter so you can see what it is you're going to order. Great food, great price and amazing service!
Great selections for a cafe in a department store.  My husband and I make this a tradition when we shop there!  Love the salads and the staff is great!

Really nice people here. Service 5 star for sure. The prices are really great for the Las Vegas strip.

It's located on the 3rd floor of Nordstroms. It's cafeteria style - grab a tray and slide it down the line. But don't let that fool you - the food is all fresh and made to order.

I grabbed some sparking white wine and ordered a Beef Dip, a cookie and 2 pizzas. 
Slid my way down to the cash register where Medardo rang me up and was nice enough to take my tray for me to my booth. 

He also opened and poured my wine for me and brought me a glass of ice water with a lemon wedge ( which I love ! ) 

When my Beef dip was ready, he delivered it to my booth. It was the best I have ever eaten ! It had a generous amount of really good quality, perfectly cooked beef. Not the fatty hard to chew type I have had before. 

The bun was toasted to perfection - not too hard and not at all soggy. If came with a side of potato chips and eau juice. 

The pizza arrived shortly after. If too was very tasty and I got whatever was left to go. 

The cookie was really yummy. It was baked in store and had big chocolate chips, macadamia nuts and coconut. 

I have to say that my server Medardo was really great! He went over and above for his customer service and friendliness. 

I totally loved my whole experience here. Which is more then I can say for many other meals I have had while being in Vegas !

The Nordstrom Café is a super easy, casual sit down restaurant that works seemlessly into shopping at the Fashion Show Mall.  It's located on the third floor of Nordstrom, in the back.  You walk up and counter order/pay, but a server brings your silverware, order, and drink refills.  If you go during lunchtime, be prepared, because it is usually packed.

Their menu runs the gamut. They have everything from soup and sandwiches to full salmon entrées, plus amazing desserts and beer & wine.  I aways buy a jar of their tomato soup to take home as well.  You just add heavy cream and heat it.  So delicious on a lazy day!

Today I ordered the penne with Tomato Alfredo.  The sauce was flavorful, but not too heavy and the pasta was cooked perfectly al dente.

Our server was attentive and our food came out pretty quickly; especially given how busy it was.  And, as usual, she brought us the after-dinner chocolate mint sticks that I love.  Just a small bite of something sweet!

Great food, great staff. I've been here many times, and I'm always impressed. Although, a few months ago I went in when it was pretty slow, and I witnessed something that made me uncomfortable. One of the managers was scolding an employee pretty harshly. Not yelling or anything, just trying to make them feel bad. I tried to get his attention to ask him a question and it was if I had flipped a switch. He was immediately nice when he saw that I was a customer with a question. The workers looked uncomfortable around him, and I even asked one of the workers if she liked working with him. She just politely shook her head. I found out his name was Scott by the end. He's not there anymore, luckily, and I asked a lot of employees about it and they all seem extremely happy. Managers shouldn't make their employees feel bad about themselves, they should help them grow. Their new manager Angie is super sweet! I can't wait to go back and have some more of their soups.

First time here and I had the Parmesan crusted chicken salad and it was good. The salad was very fresh and tasty. I loved the selections of salads they had. So you walk thru the line and there is a display of the different salads, and other foods they had like sandwiches, pasta plates and deserts. The salads are around ten dollars and most have a vinaigrette dressing and they all looked delicious. They do however have a bigger selection of other things. All in all everything was good!

Loved everything that we ordered! Wanting to try almost all the popular dishes we held back and managed to just get 6 different dishes. I ordered the parmesan crusted chicken salad. The combination of grilled sweet corn, avocado, bacon, egg, and parmesan crusted chicken tossed with honey dijon dressing on a bed of organic greens is amazing!!! My daughter ordered the mushroom ravioli. It was so good! Mushrooms are my absolute favorite especially on this dish.  The sauce was so flavorful! Make u want to lick the plate clean. The hubby and my son ordered the Tuscan grilled salmon with roasted vegetables and yukon potatoes. The fish was moist and cooked just right :) We shared the skirt steak entree with asparagus and roasted potatoes. So tender and juicy! Really like the cilantro lime vinaigrette that it came with too. Finally, for dessert we had the Creme brûlée. One of the best Creme brûlée I've ever had. Oh, I did try the tomato basil soup that came with the grilled cheese on the kids menu. It was just okay in my opinion. But I would probably order that again since I might've just underestimated it being we had a ton of food to go around. Overall, I would definitely come back here again. Price is reasonable, good service, and excellent food!

The food is SOOO good. I can tell that the ingredients are fresh and my meal was made right when I ordered it.The service is great, standard of the Nordstrom family. I found that the cafe had an interesting concept that I had not experienced before; you order first, in line, then you sit down and they bring you whatever food you did not pick up in line. It's fast food mixed with dining. Definitely worth checking out.
The cranberry turkey sandwich has a refreshing flavor. The bread is soft but crunchy.

Every time my mother-in-law comes into town we inevitably end up at the mall and usually pop into the cafe to eat. We love coming here because we are never disappointed. I have been here several times and back home we were regulars at the Nordstrom Cafe in Scottsdale.

I am a creature of habit so I always order my favorites at regular dining spots. I ordered my usual Parm Chicken Salad.  Crispy chicken with lots of avocado made fresh. The tomato basil soup is another favorite and this comes with a kids grilled cheese sandwich meal that my son always orders.  All of the other menu items are very good too (pizza, panini, pasta).  My mother in law had the salmon salad and she said it was very good. 

We had excellent service.  We asked for extra Parmesan crisps to be brought out (which are served with the soup) and they brought out extra.  I also had a glass of wine with my salad and beer is served here also. Waitress comes by to refill ice-tea. Chocolate mints are a nice treat that you get with your "check" at the end of your meal in case you ordered anything extra.  Leave a tip.

The Cafe is "Cafeteria style".  Very simple concept: 

Grab a tray
Stand in line
Place your order-(as you walk thru the line at the various stations)
Order number is placed on your tray
Grab dessert
Order wine/beer
Pay for your food

Fill up your own drinks (unless you order bottled tea)
Find a seat!

During the holidays this is a great place to pick up a nice foodie gift. 

You can buy their signature salad dressings in a package of three (I have some and they are wonderful) or even take home some of the Tomato Basil Soup in a jar (which I have done) but have to admit it tastes better at the Cafe.

Oh, and they have a fabulous cookbook too!  
Don't leave without one! 
This is on my wish list!

Dont' miss this place for a nice lunch or dinner.

The food is amazing, the service is fantastic, and the prices are reasonable. Definitely worth making a trip and dealing with difficult parking at the mall, but you should get there early if you are stopping by for lunch because the place fills up very quickly. The tomato soup is to die for, especially if you dip the bread in it. Yum!!

Nestled in the third floor among overpriced clothes you'll find one of the best cafes in all of Las Vegas.  Even though, it's just a cafe, this restaurant is up to par with some of the 5 star restaurants here in town.  My boyfriend and I were aimlessly walking throughout the mall when we stumbled upon this place.  We weren't too hungry but we figured we'd just get a bite to eat.  We couldn't resist ordering everything because many of their plates were on display.  There's something for everyone's appetite - salads, pizzas, deli sandwiches, panini sandwiches, salmon and SO much more.  

I settled for the Mixed Berry Chicken Salad - a mix of strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, mixed greens, goat cheese and candied walnuts and my boyfriend ordered the Fresh Herb Roasted Salmon - it included tons of grilled vegetables: potatoes, zucchini, carrots, bellpeppers and corn.  I was impressed with their servings condsidering their plates were just $10-13.  Their service was awesome, too.  The server was really friendly and  came by every so often to check up on us and fill up our glasses.  

Great food, great prices, great service.  I can't wait for my next visit!

This is my favorite place to eat while shopping at the Fashion Show Mall. They have a variety of soups, salads, and sandwiches that are the perfect fare for a day of shopping, along with full size entrees if you're looking for something more substantial. I am hard pressed to come here and not order the tomato basil soup. It is served with fresh basil and a Parmesan crustini. It is rich and tomatoey with a hint of creaminess. I also consistently order the blue cheese and pear salad. The salad has fresh field greens with delicious chunks of pear, generous crumbles of blue cheese, and candied pecans. I have also had a pasta with shrimp that was delicious and the roast beef and horseradish panini, both of which I believe were specials. I highly recommend this hidden gem if you're in the area.

Memories.... I used to study at a Nordstrom Cafe when I was in school. It was and still in a good comfortable place for a good study session or to get some work done. Not sure about WiFi though. 

They have a good selection of food and some of the dishes you can ask for a 1/2 size. My favorites are the very popular Tomato Soup (with buttered crostini), and salads. Sometimes I go for a straight green salad, or when I'm hungry, I go for the ones with protein (chicken, tuna, or salmon). 

It's cafeteria style, where you get a tray, order and get your food, pay at the end of the line. If you food item takes a bit more time, they give you a number to take to your table and the server brings the food to you. 

Service is always on point here and a manager often comes to check in on how you are doing. My water cup is never empty. At the end of the meal, after the server clears your dishes, they bring you chocolate mints. It's a trademark of theirs and it's so good, they sell it now.

Nordstrom Cafe is the perfect place to escape the typical mall food court.  It is located on the third floor of the Nordstrom's Department store.  They have all their dishes out on display and once you pick, the cashier will ring up your order.  The menu consists of paninis, pastas, salads, and normal cafe food.  The seating is first come first serve.  Once you are seated a server will take your drink orders (if you didn't get your own drinks at the soda fountain) and once the food is ready, they will bring the dish to your table.  I had the mushroom ravioli, which was simply delicious.  I had a bite of my boyfriend's panini, also very good.  The bill for our two dishes and drinks was $26.  A little pricey for mall food, but the service and food was excellent.  I highly recommend this place, if you are ever in the Fashion Show Mall!

Been here too many times to count and a few months back I would have given this joint 3 stars, but I definitely give it 4 stars this time around. 

My suggestion to you foodies out there is to stick with the soups, salads and hot meals, but sandwiches not so much. You usually end up paying $10 for a lot of bread and hardly any meat or fixings so to me it's not worth it. I've tried many of their delicious desserts with coffee and tea and I highly highly recommend them, especially their raspberry pie bars. 

Todays meals was simple, I had a chicken crusted salad with tomato soup and my hub had a grilled chicken and cheese panini + 2 hot teas totally $33 not including tip. This does seem a little pricy for lunch, but it's well worth it, cause the food is out of this world delicious.

The service is also pretty good from the people who take your order down to the semi waiter/bus boys, which you are not obligated to leave a tip but I do and the percentage most times depends on how much they have actually serviced my table. 

I will leave you foodies out with my best recommendation, which is do try the tomato soup. It's truly the best tomato soup I've ever had... promise!

Nice cafe in the fashion show mall. I honestly found it by accident because it's hidden in the actual department store of Nordstrom. Decent food. They have really tasty sandwiches. The service isn't that great which really sucks because the food is decent I wish the service was too. It's nice to go shop then go stop for a bite to eat here. They even have some pastries and brownies. The prices are also decent considering its inside Nordstrom "an expensive store"
I recommend it for a quick bite while shopping but don't expect great service that's all.

Make an extra trip to Nordstrom EVEN if you don't wanna shop cuz this place is just that good! 

It's like a cafeteria style set up, grab a tray, order your food and get a number. Once your food is ready they will bring it to your table.

FOOD : The salads are amazing, like seriously sooooo tasty and yummy and fresh!! My fav salad is the grilled shrimp one..perfection! Basically all the salads are good. The chicken is really good too..and it comes w/ grilled veggies. Their kids meal is really good too, grilled cheese + gourmet tasting tomato soup. Mac n cheese is good but too rich for me. Their sandwiches are good too, simple. Pizzas are really good too! 
Chocolate cupcakes are divine. 

Honestly it's just a great place for a simple lunch that is delicious and I've never had a bad experience here.
Fantastic Steak and Barley Soup.  WOW!

Omg im so full!!!

The salad was awesome here!!
I got the chicken and artichoke salad!

The grilled cheese sandwich is good too :)

The cafe is located on the second floor. 

The staff is very friendly and attentive. 

The main reason I love coming here is to order the mixed berry chicken salad. Mixed Berry Salad with Chicken has strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, candied walnuts, blue cheese & mixed greens tossed in a raspberry vinaigrette with chicken. I love it. The Nordstrom Cafe at home in Hawaii but it does not carry this salad. The vinaigrette dressing is a bit tart so I like to get it on the side since you never know if the person making the salad has a heavy hand or not. 

Other than that, this place has all my usual Nordstrom Cafe favs like the tomato basil soup. ^_^*~

This is by far, my favorite place to eat in the entire mall. It's conveniently located on the top floor of Nordstrom next to the home department. It's reasonably priced for the quality and amount of food you receive and of course, it's delicious. You order your food, walk over to the cashier to pay for it, they give you a number and the server brings your food to the table. Easy concept. 

Back in the day, I worked at Nordstrom so I've had the pleasure of trying everything on the menu. To this day, I still enjoy certain items. Of course, there is the famous tomato basil soup that everyone raves about. It's thick, creamy and flavorful. Paired with the parmesan crostini, it's excellent. I also enjoy their salads. My favorites are the salmon Niçoise, blackened salmon Cesar and the shrimp and arugula salad. All the produce is so fresh and they give you a decent amount of seafood. Their dressings are light and refreshing, not too heavy. And the portions are huge. I've also enjoyed their pizzas. They bake it fresh to order. So it arrives at your table hot and fresh. They have a kids menu which includes items like grilled cheese or small cheese pizza. They also offer small desserts like cookies, lemon or raspberry bars and creme brûlée. All of it, sweet and amazing. 

So whether you need to energize before your shopping trip or refuel after you've finished, this is a perfect spot to come.

The high ratings and the fact it was right across from the Trump made me take a gander in here for lunch.  Although it's not a bad experience, my takeaway from it was just a cafe that isn't Nordstrom's best.  

Coming inside at lunch on a Friday, it was a pretty packed.  Although the line eventually got moving, the line would halt for a bit until the manager gave the okay to let more people in because there was no room for seating.  Perhaps a take-out line separate would help a bit here in case people were in a rush.  

The menu selection is not bad - from soups to sandwiches to some entrees and salads, there were definitely options and stations for each of them.  I got the tomato bisque soup (small) and the Chinese chicken salad which came out to be about $15.  The tables were a little messy as they were still trying to get around the busy environment.  The food itself was okay.  The soup wasn't bad although it's not the best tomato bisque and the salad was just okay too - not very flavorful in the dressing and the ingredients not much different from other Chinese Chicken Salads.  There were a lot of drink options including some alcoholic beverages unsurprisingly.  

Although it's not in central Vegas, I found the Nordstrom Cafe Bistro to be a much better experience overall in other locations.

In love with this café! Love going every time I go to Fashion show. I always stick to the same since its so good, a salad and tomato soup! So you usually order, pay and they bring it to your table. Last time I was there they took a little while to bring our food, probably because it was busy. It's a little hidden, but you'll find it inside Nordstrom.

Yummy lunch! Was not expecting this. 
It's one of those grab a tray and order and they will bring it to you kinda spots. 

Tomato soup-  3.95 for a small coup. 
Apple and cheese salad.

The chicken was amazing. Will be back.

Where do I begin?  I'm a Nordstrom groupie!  One day I'm buying skincare products, the next time, workout gear, and the time after that, shoes.  The only thing in common with every visit is the Cafe.  Chinese Chicken, Mixed Berry, Salmon Nicoise, and the Citrus Lime Chicken salads are all DAMN good!!  If I just rated their salads, the Cafe would get a perfect 5 stars.  They only get 4 stars because their lemon bars taste like ass (sorry Nordie) and the tomato basil is second rate to La Madeleine's tomato basil (Vegas needs a La Mad!!! Stat!).  Their cookies are pretty dope though.  

Overall, I'll take my NARS with a side of Cafe.  Please and thank you. :)

I can't believe this place is not reviewed enough. This is one of my favorite brunch places in Las Vegas. The view is fantastic and the lunch choices is top notch. There is a great selection of soup, sandwiches, salad and pasta to choose from. For $10-15 a person you're guaranteed to get your money's worth in terms of food, service and decor.

Located on the top/3rd floor of Nordstrom, this little cafe is a hidden gem. It can definitely get busy in there during lunchtime, and I can see why -- lunchtime specials are great! 

They have $5 grilled cheese sandwiches and some other things that come with soup. The $5 lunch special is actually a kid's special but it is portioned perfectly for an adult-sized lunch, in my opinion. If you wanted something more, they have great salads, pastas, and full-sized portions that are a little more expensive but a good size.

The service is great too! Everyone is nice and even though this isn't a full-fledged restaurant, it feels like a sit-down restaurant because they have bussers who offer to refill your drink and clear your table.

Great lunch spot in the FSM, which is handy for the businesses that are a short drive there. I definitely recommend coming here for lunch.
Tomato soup with crostini is good if u like tomato soup. Mushroom ravioli is excellent with delicious as well as salads

The service here is impeccable.  It is nice and quiet, and a good place to go to if you want to chat with a friend.  Or, sit down after an exhausting shopping day and you want to avoid the horrible food court at the Fashion Show Mall.

The tomato basil soup is to die, and the wild mushroom ravioli is so so good.

I've been a fan of Nordys cafe since I was in high school.. yes so BOOGEE that I came here with my friends after school lol. But not that often and even now not that often... but their tomato soup is always a treat!

If you want a fairly calm place to eat and unwind come enjoy a salad, hot entree, or chefs special and finish off with some dessert!

This place is a classic and you'll never be dissatisfied with the service or quality.

You WILL see lots of men sitting alone here while waiting for their wives to finish shopping.. just an FYI ;)

The food was good, and light.  It felt healthy.  I had the grilled cheese and a cup of tomato soup.  When my grilled cheese came out, it was a bit too black/cooked, so I sent it back.  They had replaced it pretty quickly, and it was good.  The tomato soup was good too.  

It was a nice place to take a break from shopping.  My roommate got a chicken salad of sorts and she liked hers as well!

Love this place!  Service is stellar, ambience is warm and inviting, and the food is fresh and delicious.  I've been here a time or two before and they are always consistent! Servers are attentive and prompt! Restaurant is clean,  and the selection of soft music is a great way to relax and wind down while/after shopping.  An overall hidden gem that I love to frequent!

This cafe is located on the third floor of the department store which makes it kind of inconvenient to get to. However, right when you walk in the staff greets you and they're all so welcoming. This place has a chill ambience, the best I can describe it is it's kinda like an upscale Panera Bread. They physically display each of their dishes on the menu in front of the counter so you can see how they look, which I thought was neat. When we got to our table the waiters were really attentive, the service was great. My girlfriend ordered their chicken tomato Alfredo and I ordered the Chinese chicken salad. The food quality was... Eh. The chicken from her pasta was rubbery and wasn't really hot. It might've been sitting out on a warmer for a while maybe? My salad was pretty good though. All this food wasn't up to par with the price, so coming here once was enough.

For the price the food is awesome.  I had the skirt steak chimmichuri ($13.50)and creme brulee ($5).  Both were delicious.  The service could have been better.  I had never been here and am still unsure if the waitstaff gets you drink refills or if you get them yourself--I was never offered a soda refill.  I figured if they did nothing more than bring my food to me initially then no reason to leave a tip right?--I mean Carl's Jr. brings your food to your table and I never leave a tip there.  The server does come by half way through your meal to leave a little tray with mints and a thank you buisness card--I guess this is asking for a tip?  Aside from my confusion if this is self-service or semi-wait serviced I enjoyed the food so much I'm still giving it 5 stars.

As I ascended into the third level of Nordstrom (who knew?!), I worried. What fancy-ass place are we (my co-workers and I) going for a random casual lunch? I wasn't sure what to expect. They used fabulous and delicious to describe it, but that didn't help much. I was expecting Denny's but fancier and I was half right! The Nordstrom Cafe is more like Starbucks on steroids plus Cheesecake Factory flair.

I enjoyed my tomato bisque soup with crostini and salmon nicoise salad very much. The dark stormy within my soul turned to a rainbow of sunshine and green pastures. MMM  I enjoyed it so much, I started searching Pinterest to find recipes to replicate these delicious dishes. 

As expected, lunch was the pricey. The total price ended up being $21 (give or take ) for soup, salad, and diet coke. But the service was impeccable. Our waitress checked in our group frequently to do her thang. You work for those tips, girl! Nordstrom Café, you became my favorite dining destination at Fashion Show.

I love this place!!  First of all, when you go there, expect that you will be paying a bit more for your lunch but it is completely worth it.  You walk in and order your food and you are greeted with the service you expect from nordstrom.  After placing your order, go through the line to pay but do not skip over the beautiful display of deserts!!  They are wonderful!!!  Once you have paid you pick a great seat in the beautiful nordstrom dining room.  Then someone brings you your food in that great Nordstrom service again.  Even though drinks are self service they will get them for you.  You end the meal with a wonderful chocolate mint.  They sell wonderful things at the cafe such as olive oil the tomato soup and their chocolates.  This place is so worth a trip to fashion show.

I love this place. This is a great cafe with healthy options that are delicious! Considering the food is made fresh. The food does not take a lot of time to receive your food. I'd suggest bringing cash for tip though because there are waiters who come by and bring your food and refill your drinks. It is very clean and enjoyable with coworkers. Once and a while there will be a screaming kid because it's their lunch time as well, but most of the time it's a nice place to enjoy lunch and have conversation. I enjoy the chicken cilantro salad. The portion is perfect, Lettuce is chopped at a nice size where I don't need to cut it. The dressing is already mixed and the chicken is cold,
Not causing a weird warmth on the lettuce. I will be back and will take photos next time.

I freakin love this place.  Super duper service and food.  They have great salads and good sweat treats too.  The prices are super reasonable and it is a great quiet laid back place to grab something to eat while shopping at the Fashion Show Mall.  I pretty much eat here every single time I go there.  Last time I ate the special soup, artichoke something, and it was one of the best soups I have ever had.

I did not even read the reviews from my yelp friends - Mamie P. and I did some shoe shopping and realized it was after 3:30 PM and we had not eaten anything since breakfast!

We knew the mall options near Nordstrom are limited, so we went upstairs to check out the cafe.  We both ordered the nicoise salad with salmon, and we both licked our plates CLEAN!

it was soooo ridiculously tasty!  I have never been a cold nicoise fan and I especially don't like cooked tuna much, but it looked good so we went with it.  I've got to honor my French heritage a little.

Indulgence!  Fresh field greens, basalmic dressing, hidden tasty treats like capers and kalamata olives, tomatoes, red onion, hard boiled egg, HOT potato wedges, haricort verts, and this deliciously herb-y and garlicky salmon!  YUMMMMM seriously.  and a yummy little crouton to go with it!

I was totally impressed and would definitely come back for lunch and to try more salads.  The prices are reasonable too!

The only thing I can think right now is why it's taken me SO LONG to finally get here. Now, I'm trying to think of any reason to come back!

I had a couple hours to kill between jobs and I wanted to stay in the area. This seemed like the perfect fit since I needed something casual, but of course, delicious. Also, they open an hour earlier than most restaurants (10am). When I arrived just after 10, it was mostly empty. I peered at their displays of dishes and referenced the menu for ingredients and details. I ordered with one of the staff behind the counter, then, I was handed a number and ticket. I took these items to the register, paid, and was given back the number and a glass for my beverage (since I was dining in).

Grilled Shrimp & Arugula Salad w/ Sweet Corn ($12.95): Organic arugula, wild shrimp, petite tomatoes, grilled corn, warm polenta croutons, parmesan cheese crisp, and creamy garlic vinaigrette. Oh my word. What a wonderful salad! The shrimp were plump, delicious, and cooked perfectly. I loved the combination of the ingredients, all tied together with that great vinaigrette. Also? The polenta croutons were such a pleasant surprise - yum! Easily one of the best salads I've had and I'm absolutely coming back for it!

Grilled Santa Fe Chicken Sandwich/Panini ($10.50): Blackened chicken, Jack cheese, roasted red peppers, caramelized onion, avocado, chili pepper aioli, crisp country bread. The sandwich was packed and the flavors were nice. There's even a little kick from the chili pepper aioli. The bread had a nice crust, too. This was served with housemade/kettle chips.

Blueberry Almond Tart ($4.25): Beautiful tart with light flavors and a nice crust. I didn't expect to see pastries and it was a nice treat at the end of my meal.

Although you order at the counter, once you sit down, there are wonderful servers that bring your utensils, napkins, food, and even refills on your drinks! The service was amazing!! I was approached by 2-3 different servers, but Mike waited on me primarily and he was phenomenal. Extremely friendly, attentive, and accommodating.

I am very pleased with my experience and plan on returning in the near future. BTW, by noon (Friday), it was packed! Come by 11:30 to beat the lunch rush.

I've come here so many times because I work up the street. I keep wanting to try new things but I can't because I'm too hooked on old faithfuls. 

Blackened Salmon Caesar Salad is amazing and you will get full. Their Caesar dressing is thick and rich, just how I love it.
