The Parmesan Crusted Chicken Salad is wonderful. I get it tossed in that Caesar dressing I'm addicted to. 

The Tomato Basil Soup is a no brainer. I used to get the bowl but then would get too full to eat my other food, so now I get the cup. 

I slowed down with my visits when I found out my all time favorite, the Wild mushroom Ravioli, was no longer available. I couldn't understand why. Everyone loved it! I was heartbroken to say the least. That ravioli has gotten me thru some rough work days, and now it's gone. I'm sure I'll eat here again because it's really that good, but man what a bummer. I wish they'd bring it back.

OMG....we had a great meal, great service and a great time.  My co-worker and friend retired this week.  Our company provides an opportunity for a group lunch.  She could have chosen any place in town but insisted on the Marketplace Café.  She loves the salmon nicoise salad and the tomato basil soup.  I was not sure how the restaurant could accommodate a party of 25 without creating a logistics nightmare at the ordering counter.  But with an advanced phone call or two, they worked everything out.  They not only set up one large reserved seating area but they took our orders at the table.  I was able to add a few balloons and table decorations so it really looked like a party.  When the group arrived, they were very impressed.  Brendan Beaudreault, the Assistant Manager went above duty and was so gracious. He put together a  Nordstrom gift bag full of wonderful items and presented it to our friend.  She was over the moon.  Frank, our favorite server took amazing care of us.  Everyone was thrilled with their food choices and the desserts were divine as usual.  It was a great day for our retiree and the rest of us too.  Five stars for sure!
Their tomatoe soup is my fav! Along with the Chicken Lime Cilantro Salad. Soooo guud!!

I rather go eat here any day than to go to the food court. It is located on the 3rd floor of Nordstrom, its cafeteria style where you grab a tray and go down the line. If the food ready then they'll just give it you, such as the tomato soup, nut usually the sandwiches, pizza, pasta, or salad will be brought to your table after you order and pay.

The tomato soup is one of the best. If you get a bowl you will get a few pieces of toasted bread. Also tried the Grilled Chicken Pesto Sandwich,  toasted and so good, its shredded chicken inside. You will receive a side of homemade chips with the sandwich.

There are numerous reasons to admire Nordstrom's Cafe; It's semi "need to know someone who knows where it is" location, brick oven pizzas and calzones, and a menu that's always a little different from your previous visit. 
They have a small selection, but everything is amazing and freshly made: Panini's, salads, pizzas, pastas, and soups are their main fair with great desserts as well. You could blind pick anything they offer and be pleased with your choice.
If they're available, I suggest the Calzone or the Salmon meal.
Also a plus, they serve beer! Never a bad thing. 
They also have a quasi waiter service which will provide you drink refills and take away your plates. The staff is always nice and attentive, and the joint its self is typically busy, but never busy enough to cause you to wait.
If you're in the Fashion Show and need some grub that's worth a damn, definitely skip the food court and head to Nordstrom's Cafe on the third floor of Nordstrom's.

All I have to say it use to be amazing the service the food, everything was amazing. Sadly now the food isn't so great anymore and the service is absolutely horrible I went in on my lunch had a bowl of soup and a side salad. Not once did I get asked if I needed anything, but the guy did come by as he saw me getting ready to leave and leave chocolates and a tip tray all I thought was you have to be kidding. Another bad experience once again went for lunch and had my soup and salad, and I asked for my bread it never came I literally asked three different waiters and was completely ignored. So sad to say my coworkers and I will be looking for a new spot to enjoy our lunch since we all have had terrible service and food there recently. Last but not least bought two Nordies cookies and I could literally hit someone on the head and knock them out because of hard the cookies were.

like everything associated with the Nordstroms chain this is a nice little gem of a restaurant located on the 3rd floor of their store at fashion show. Its cafeteria order style but then they have a waitress bring you the meal. The food is very good..i had the tomato and basil soup to start and then the pasta with meat sauce. both were very good and a suprise from a department store cafe. had a boysenberry bar for dessert..tasty! the service was excellent and the surroundings pleasant. as i stated its hard to go wrong with Nordstroms one of my favorite stores too :)

I love love love Nordstrom cafe!!!  My favorite is the blackened salmon on Caesar salad which isn't on the menu but they will always make it.   The magic bar is also always an amazing treat!  


I love everything about Nordstrom

This little gem was quite the surprise.  I had never been here before, and was heavily recommended from numerous coworkers that I should check it out.  I was not disappointed.  The food here is picturesque and absolutely gorgeous.  Everything I tasted was delicious, and made we want to come back. The staff are nice and helpful.  The environment is awesome, as the eating area has high ceilings and big windows to allow a lot of natural sunlight into the room.  My only complaint is that the setup is a bit confusing, and the prices are a little steep for what you get.  Again, the food is delicious, but $15 for a sandwich and a tiny cup of soup is a deterrent to keep me from coming here all the time.

Very poor customer service. The girl's expression taking our order was just as SOUR as the tomato basil bisque. Entré quality was fair. Compared to Nordstrom at Valley Fair and Stanford (Bay Area, CA), this place was disappointing.

I work near Nordstrom's Marketplace Cafe and it is a hidden gem of the Fashion Show Mall in my opinion! The shrimp and polenta mixed green salad is one of my favorites, as are their specials such as the Shirimp Po' Boy and their Tomato soup! They also have an excellent array of desserts for those in need of satisfying their sweet tooth!

I also enjoy the quick "cafeteria style" ordering process but that your food is still delivered to your table and you are attended to by a waiter while in the dining room. Don't forget about the little chocolate straws their deliver when they clear your plates! And be sure to tip the wait staff a few dollars, they are attentive but not overbearing!

Mall food sucks, but The Nordstrom Cafés are always reliable. The salad and panini we got were made in front of us and were amazing. Portions were generous as well. Service was great too, and we were given yummy mint chocolates at the end.

The price is a little steep here and the food made me sick. Also the way they name food is weird, so a "caprese" sandwich does in fact come with meat. Even though that's not what a caprese is and they just like confusing all the vegetarians that come in here. The soups were strange and lukewarm and the only redeeming item was the Magic Bar.

The only thing I hate about this cafe is that I always over eat. From pizza, salads , and amazing entree you really can't go wrong. Oh yeah and they also have dessert which they get you at the end when you about to pay and you don't have your food yet. So you end up eating dessert before your entree first at time. Or I just don't have any self control.

My first time at Nordstrom Cafe!  

I am here in the Fashion Show Mall often, so now I have a solid choice for casual dining :)

They had some great Panini sandwiches that were calling my name.   They were surprisingly good actually!  Lots of flavor in the pesto and olive oil...yum!

We finished with the Creme Brulee.  Good rendition here, with a nice crispy layer of goodness hiding the rich custard inside.  

Recommended for some quick eats to recuperate from all that money being spent :P
The Nordstrom Cafe never disappoints...great food, great prices - and HELLO great shopping, what's not to love?  Ate here twice while on my visit to Vegas - fab!

Would come back again!

Amazing Chicken Pesto Panini. Kind of a hassle to get to and pricier than most casual cafes but some of their choices are really spot on.

My coworkers and I eat lunch here 2x a week! It's really good, and pretty quick to get in and out of if you arrive before 11:30. 

The food: 
Salads made to order (nicoise, crispy chicken, salmon caesar, and my favorite.. chicken with berries). 
Delicious Sandwiches (recommend california with turkey, bacon, avocado and melted cheese)
Soups
Pasta

Basically very high quality awesome tasting american food in a sort of cafeteria setting. 

Staff is incredible. Friendly and constantly refilling your drink, offering to get you whatever.. awesome. Sadly the staff here is far better than the staff I've encountered lately at 5 star restaurants.. only difference is most of the staff here doesn't have the requisite plastic surgery.

Food is always fantastic and today's review is solely based off the amazing customer service. 


My friend and I came here to eat lunch (12-27-2014) and this place was packed.... lines out the entrance. After we paid and walked over to find a table, there were several tables that opened up but still had plates. The manager (I am assuming he is a manager because he was one of the two wearing dress shirts) came over, cleaned off the plates and wiped down the table top as well as the seat. Gayle was our server and was very attentive, refilling our coffee, remembering each of our orders and desserts. Also at the end of our lunch, we wanted to pick up our dessert later so we asked her to keep it in the front. 

Returning after shopping to pick up our dessert, I asked the cashier for our cake and was very prompt even though it was busy inside. I saw the manager again bringing food out. My friend and I are restaurant owners and naturally we are very observant when it comes to front and back house/customer service. We were thoroughly impressed how the manager wasn't just delegating to get the task done, but he was jumping in to get things done. You don't see that in Las Vegas corporate restaurants much... at all!!!

I asked the cashier who the gentleman was, and he stated his name is Scott and was the general manager. 


Well done Nordstrom, your 5 star customer service isn't just reflected in the department stores but also your restaurant as well.

Excellent place to go when you want to avoid the hectic food court! Located in the third floor of Nordstrom

When you walk in you see sample displays of the food and place your order at the register and pay. They hand you a number to display at your table and a server will bring you your food. During your meal the servers will refill your drinks and bring any additional condiments that you may want.  Also if you want to order desert or additional food the server can take care of that, no need to fall in line. 

Personally I really enjoy the salads and sandwiches. On many occasions my husband and I will split one of each. Go to sandwiches at the club and the Santa Fe chicken sandwich, for salad I enjoy the cilantro line chicken.  The sandwiches also come with a side of chips.
Meal is concluded with complimentary mint chocolate candies brought by the server.

We have yet to be disappointed by this cafe!
Cafe and restaurant at Nordstrom. The pastry was really lovely and the staff constantly checked that we had everything. A minus is that we got coffee and tea in plastic cups!

Located on the same floor as the lingerie section. After shopping and you want a bite to eat, here's good option for you. Look around for the food display, figure out what you want, grab a drink, a tray, place your order, grab your number and pay at the end of the line.

Skirt Steak:
Comes with asparagus, carrots, potatoes and chimichurri. Get it medium rare or rare since this is a thin piece of meat, otherwise, you'll be gnawing on beef jerky. For $15, you get a pretty nice meal. 5/5

Parmesan-crusted Chicken Salad:
Not the healthiest salad on their menu and it's not the best one either. 3/5

Nicoise Salad with Salmon:
Greens, onions, green beans, hard boiled egg slices, potaoes and salmon. This is what I normally get from here but I never learn my lesson of asking not to put onions, olives and egg yolks. I actually spend time removing these things rom my salad. 4.5/5

Roasted Salmon:
Comes with zucchini, carrots, potatoes and corn. I got extra carrots instead of zucchini. The salmon was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The veggies were roasted and seasoned. The corn was a bit salty though so, I didn't eat the whole thing. Saved me from having corn stuck in between my teeth. 4/5

I love the Nordstrom Cafe! I love the organic and hormone free! I love that Nordstrom has such strict rules about what they allow in their food. The staff is amazing and I love the service that I receive here!

5 stars for a cafe in a department store!
The menu selection is above & beyond anything I would have ever expected to come out of a mall. 

The Tomato Basil Soup with the Parmesan Crostini is so delicious. Definitely the best Tomato Basil I've ever had! 

Mixed Berry Salad with Chicken is my favorite salad. It has strawberries, raspberries, blackberries, candied walnuts, blue cheese & mixed greens tossed in a raspberry vinaigrette with chilled chicken. So good. I'm normally not too huge on blue cheese in my salads, because its such a dominant flavor- but with the berries, it neutralizes the sweetness. 

OKAY, & the best part of all...they have Creme Brulee! Very, very good Creme Brulee. Definitely the cherry on top of a great meal! 

Now that I have my own mouth watering, I will stop talking about food & let you know that the service is wonderful! Its kind of self service in the sense that you pay for your food, get your drink & pick a seat. From there- a server will bring your food out to you & refill your drink. I have never met anyone less than pleasant at Nordstrom Cafe- fine dining service in a casual dining environment. 

So next time you find yourself starving while shopping at the Fashion Show- ditch the food court & head over to the 3rd floor of Nordstroms where the cafe is nestled behind the teen clothing section.

I have a hard time with this place. I eat there once a month and order the same thing. The soup is always hot and fresh. The salad consistency is never there. I always get stale greens that are drenched in dressing and 1/2 the portion of what the actual salad portion is supposed to be. If you're going to serve me 1:2 a salad, then charge me 1:2 the price. The sweet options are never fresh and the tipping situation is weird. If I'm getting my own food, beverage, and brining all of it to the table, what reason are you giving me to tip?

I've been to a few Nordstrom Cafes, but this one is indeed the nicest...no surprise since it's at the Nordstrom at the Fashion Show Mall on the Vegas strip.  This one is the biggest and best decorated one, plus, I think it has the largest menu.  I had the Santa Fe panini and it was excellent.  My boyfriend loved his California panini.  Between the two, I liked my sandwich better.  Have the Santa Fe if you want a little zest!

Great service & amazing food. This is my favorite lunch spot in Vegas.  Definitely try the tomato basil soup with crostini.  The salads are all great too, but sometimes heavy on the dressing so I always ask for mine on the side.

Love love Nordstorm Cafe. Fairly cheap prices for quality food. But man does it get busy.

There's a fairly wide variety of things to choose from, from 8-10 salads, 3 pizza options, to 3 pasta options, and 5-6 sandwich items, as well as a variety of desserts to chose from. 

For bargain deals, get the grilled cheese and tomato soup combo (its listed as for kids but they don't care if adults order it :P) The tomato soup is DELICIOUS. It's just so yummy and a perfect pair for the grilled cheese. 

For salads, I personally love the mixed berry and chicken as well as the blue cheese and pear salad. Everything is made to order. 

I don't particularly care for the pizzas, but the wild mushroom pasta is delicious, with a hefty portion! 

After a long day of shopping and browsing through this huge mall, Nordstorm Cafe is where quality meets quantity!

I have a thing for all of Nordy's cafes. How are they so good?! The fries alone are enough to bring me back repeatedly, but then they give you those teeny chocolate mint sticks at the end...and every location carries some different dishes, so I feel like I need to check each one out to see what they have that's special. I see what you're doing, Nordstrom!

They primarily offer soups, sandwiches, and salads, but also pizzas, pastas, and more standard entrées.  Beautiful desserts too! Most of the food feels pretty healthy, and I appreciate that they list calories on the menu. If you experience difficulty determining what to eat go with a salad because I've tried almost all, and they are always fresh and delicious.

When I dined here most recently I just needed a little snack as I was going to dinner in a few hours. I had their (apparently famous) tomato soup. It comes with a garlicky crostini, and the soup is just slightly creamy. I don't like tomato soup on it's own generally, but this was divine. Really. I get why it's famous. I just had a cup, and it was enough to tide me over, but I sure would have enjoyed devouring an entire bowl. My friend had the Shrimp and Arugula Salad. I don't know if this is available exclusively in Vegas, but they don't offer it at my regular Nordstrom (sad face). It comes with magical crispy polenta croutons and a really nice sort of creamy herby dressing. 

Their prices are average, and customer service is decent (not amazing, as you might expect at Nordstrom, but never bad). At this location you get your tray, make your selection, and pay for your meal at once, and then they give you a number and bring your food to you. You can always order additional items from the server, and they will still bring you a check at the end of your meal even if you didn't add anything, so I try to have a little cash with me to use as a tip. They are going for an upscale look at this location, but it's a little dated looking. For dining in Vegas you can't beat the quality or the price.

My friend CB brought me here. Food was delicious. Service enhanced by our great server Medardo E .  He made the whole experience better. I enjoyed the half sandwich and salad. My friend enjoyed her favorite soup. Can't wait to go back next time I'm in LV

I can't believe I've never written a review about Nordstrom Cafe, saying that it is one of my favorite spots! Aww, their tomato soup holds a special place in my heart. The atmosphere is calm and peaceful w/sounds of jazz in the background. The people are especially pleasant and always around when you need them. Prices are pretty reasonable, but if your a lil on the broke side order the cheese pizza or the grilled cheese/tomato soup off the kids menu, they're enough for an adult, but the price for kids :) I love the variety of quality food and the deserts are out this realm!! If you go out there, you have to of course try the tomato soup, but the raspberry almond bar is quite deelish!

This cafe was a pleasant surprise and hidden far away from the rest of the mall on the top floor of Nordstroms.  The atmosphere was relaxing, which was a blessing after spending a delerious part of the afternoon in the fashion show mall.

This cafe is essentially a cafeteria, but with much better food and all made to order.  I had an excellent grilled salmon nicoise salad, which the salmon was perfectly cooked and had excellent flavor.  The dressing was very tasty but not overwhelming and didn't drown the food.

I finished with a giant chocolate dipped macaroon, which was excellent.  Moist and not overly sweet.  I could barely get through half of it.

The food is much better than some of the tourist-trap restaurants on the strip for much less, and it's a good get break from the crazy strip and annoying tourists.

During my last day in Vegas I was pretty tired of shelling out $25-30 per meal for something mediocre so I thought of walking across my hotel to Fashion Show Mall to find the Nordstrom's Cafe. The prices are the same as your home Nordstrom's, and the choices are great! You can get a large sandwich to share for $8.50 or one of their hearty soups for $4/bowl, $3/cup.

If you want something quick and easy like a sandwich without the Vegas pricetag, come here!

The perfect lunch spot on the Strip. If you plan to go to the Fashion Show mall anyway, this is a no brainer. The food is prepared fresh for you. The taste and seasoning are perfect. The portions are generous. It is just a bit pricey, on average my wife and I spend $40.00 before tip. It is very clean and the staff are very attentive. I highly recommend this Cafe.

This cafe and Nieman Marcus' are the best places to eat at the Fashion Show Mall.  The food choices are all healthy, fresh, high quality and reasonably priced.  Cafeteria style where you grab a tray and select from a variety of delicious soups, salads, sandwiches and entrees.  Gr8 atmosphere, friendly servers and relaxing setting make a better choice than the food court.

Decor: 4/5
-typical diner style dining with tables and comfy booths

Service: 3/5
-service can be more efficient and better. 
-entire order was placed at the counter, you pay at the other end and chances are you may have to wait because phone calls get priority
-the sandwich is made to order to expect another 10 minutes for that to be made

Food: 5/5
-tomato basil soup was thick, rich and tasty. I wasn't a fan of the hard bread
-chicken avocado club was a legit and hefty sandwich. Dipped in the soup and my taste buds were in heaven

I love eating here because the food is good and I feel fancy. It is a bit pricey, but still affordable enough to go once in a while. I loved the skirt steak they served and it reminded me of the steak frites at Mon Ami Gabi, only here it is not cut as thin and only comes in one flavor.

The manager Joseph is amazing. 

As soon as I walked in, the three employees behind the counter offered to help me. It was like I was the only person in the room. 

It was my first time here, and it left me with a 5 star impression.

First off, the food is really really good. I like that everything tastes so flavorful and fresh. I was more than starved and the Trump Hotel employees recommended this gorgeous little cafe on the third floor of Nordstrom. 

I ordered the steak sandwich to go and had the roasted chicken for dine in. The chicken was slightly undercooked when I hit the bone. I requested that they heat it up. Instead the manager, Joseph apologized generously and replaced the whole chicken. So, given that I am really easy to please, they went above and beyond my expectations. 

Food and Service are 5 stars. The management is superb and it seems as though the employees really enjoy working here. Indicating to me that they take care of the employees and that makes me feel more welcome when the employees are happy.

I love it when a restaurant experience can make the whole trip worthwhile and my trip just got started.

One of my favorite places to eat!! I come here maybe once every other week. I would go more often if it was closer to my house. Their ingredients are organic and always fresh!! It used to be more consistent but I feel as though they have been slacking lately, otherwise I would have given them 5 stars.

I have been coming to this restaurant for years. I've never had bad service, the food is great and consistent, the price isn't too bad, and it's always clean. I would put 10 stars as their grade if I could! :)
Great food and spot on service! Everything taste delightful and is made fresh to order. One of my favorite cafe spots in Vegas!

Great food quality, fair price, great ambiance, and very close to my hotel Ordered the santa fe panini and it was perfect. Service was great and fast, the place was clean and the location is perfect (3rd Floor inside of Nordstrom). Overall it was a very pleasant experience.
